title: Plumbing Parts Quiz
description: How well do you know plumbing parts and fixtures? Test your knowledge of pipes, fittings, and plumbing basics.

questions.question: What is the curved pipe under a sink called that traps water to prevent sewer gases from entering the home?
Which plumbing fitting connects two pipes at a 90-degree angle?
What is a ball valve used for in plumbing?
options: Controlling water flow with a quarter-turn handle

questions.question: Which plumbing tool is a long, flexible metal cable used to clear clogs deep in drain pipes?
What is the flapper in a toilet tank?
options: A rubber seal that lifts to release water into the bowl when flushing
The float that controls water level

questions.question: Which type of pipe material, colored blue or red, is flexible and commonly used in modern residential water supply lines?
What is a T-fitting (tee) used for in plumbing?
options: Connecting pipes at a T-shaped junction to split or combine flow

questions.question: Which device is installed in a water heater to prevent excessive pressure buildup?
options: Temperature and pressure relief valve (T&P valve)

questions.question: What is a coupling used for in plumbing?
options: Changing the direction of a pipe
Joining two straight pieces of pipe together

questions.question: Which plumbing fixture is a low-mounted basin used for personal hygiene, common in European bathrooms?
What is the purpose of a shut-off valve (stop valve) located near a fixture?
options: Allowing you to turn off water supply to a specific fixture for repairs

questions.question: Which plumbing component prevents water from flowing backward into the clean water supply?
What is a reducer fitting used for?
options: Connecting two pipes of different diameters

questions.question: Which material is the traditional choice for drain, waste, and vent pipes in older homes?
What is a basin wrench specifically designed for?
options: Reaching and tightening faucet mounting nuts in tight spaces under sinks
